NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS
119 GREGORY HALL
URBANA, ILLINOIS
'
Mr. Hobart fan Duyn, Associate Director
Division of Education
\ V. K. Kellogg Foundation
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Bob#
Herewith the revised budget you requested, incorporating the new Kellogg
grant and revising for the balance of the year*
We would appreciate haring this report considered ®confidential,® and I
am distributing copies only to the HAEB Executive Gaamittee. I do feel
that the generosity of the Kellogg Foundation and the peculiarly close
relationship between the MAE® and the Foundation deserve all the d@~
tail provided in the footnotes, with reeogriiss^le frankness.
Before this report is formally reviewed by your organisation, if that is
necessary* I should like to discuss it with you orally, and answer any
questions which may occur to you between receipt of this report and
my visit there next week.
In view of the fact that the Center is holding a meeting at East
Lansing concurrently with the WAC meeting I1 a attending there, but
extending over through Sferch 17, it appears that I will not now be
able to visit you until rather late afternoon March 17. WS.H this be
satisfactory? I shall be bringing my car to facilitate the transportation
problem*
Under separate cover I am. also forwarding to you revised lists of materials
now available from JfAEB and the first of several new ff operations reports
meeting in Eugene, Oregon.
Wtaaast regards, and I shall expect to see you March 17, unless I hear from
you (at the Kellogg Center at MSG) to the contrary.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skomia
Executive Director
HJSims
